Reviews.Title: “If You have a car. Best for your money”
Reviews.Author: Vacationeer999
Reviews.Content: I rented a Car when visiting Rome. This Hotel happens to be a little far from main sightseeings, but it's in a quiet place. By car is 30 minutes - 1 hour depending on traffic. Very nice views. The hotel is in the outskirts of Rome so you can see green fields from it. Excellent customer service. Will be the place where locals go for a family day. Based on quality and cost I strongly recommend renting a car and staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Ann L
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for three nights in April. While it is a trek from the city center, the hotel is beautiful and the staff is wonderful and go out of their way to make sure you have a great stay. Francesco was very helpful and a joy to talk to. He gave us great recommendations for restaurants, some of the best food we had in Italy! Great service, clean hotel, good breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless nights at inaccessible hotel”
Reviews.Author: 806Chris55
Reviews.Content: The location of the property is terrible: you have to spend between 1.5 and 2 hours ONE WAY to get to the center using public transportation (with at least 2 transfers and 15 euros out of your pocket per person). Taxi will cost you 50 euros one way. On a map it looks like hotel is close to Leonardo da Vinci International airport (FSO), but no shuttle bus is provided. And a taxi again will cost you 50 euros or more (since taxi drivers do some tricks). You walk along the street (even to a bus stop) at your own rick because there is no walk way. We saw cars and motorcycles passed dangerously close to pedestrians. The walls at hotel are not sound-proof at all. It's like people walking and talking right next to your bed 24 hours a day. We will never stay at Selva Candida again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think”
Reviews.Author: Eli863
Reviews.Content: Property itself is OK (especially landscape), though walls are so thin that you can constantly hear your neighbors and people walking in a hall at night and in early morning. Never got a good night sleep. A bath is so tiny you even couldn't turn around. Plus I saw cockroaches there twice. Rooms also have no English speaking TV channels. Another big problem is hotel's location. It's in the middle of nowhere. Just to get to the nearest train station you have to ride bus for 25 minutes, and they randomly run once in a half hour. One day the bus drivers went on strike, and no-one at the hotel thought to mention this to customers. In general staff will never be proactive to do something helpful for you. To take a taxi to the nearest train station will cost you 40 euros. Another huge problem is that hotel has no walk way, so once when walking at night with no street lights we were almost hit by a passing car.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but well out of town”
Reviews.Author: alex w
Reviews.Content: Hotel Selva Candida has some really strong plusses and minuses. To start with, it's well well out of town. This is a real issue. If you are planning a Rome holiday, try and get a city center hotel. There are some good deals to be had, we had 6 nights for two at under 300 euros, but the travel was excruiating. Plus points: It's absolutely gorgeous. The gardens are idyllic, you could just sit out there and enjoy the scenery and occasional lizards scampering past. The drinks at the minibar are actually reasonably priced! You can use the minbar without getting hit by an insane bill. There's a nice shop across the road, handy for stocking up. Free parking Free wifi (but a little slow, and you may have to go to the lobby for a signal It's clean, and well cleaned every day. It's secure. Each room has barred windows and a safe. Minus points: It can get noisy, and the walls aren't thick. There's almost no control over the heat settings in the rooms. A teeny tiny bath for my less than slender western frame. There's only one plug in the room. If you unplug the TV you can also use that. Here's the biggy - Rome public transport is famously prone to wildcat strikes. Our last day we checked out, and no-one at the hotel thought to mention all the public transport was out for the day. Don't assume the staff will do something basically helpful like this of their own accord. If you stay here, have a plan for travel. The staff assume you've taken this into account and will have no sympathy for you if you complain about the hotel being inaccessible. If you are considering getting a car, note the standard of driving in Rome, and the number of cars with serious damage to them. If you're used to UK driving, don't assume driving in Rome is realistic. Consider where you will park if you're heading to the city center. The nearest Metro stations aren't situated in areas where it's safe to leave a car, or areas where you'll have any shot at finding a parking space. Consider that petrol is far more expensive (about 30% more than UK) and many roads are toll roads. Many toll roads can only be used by Italian residents. There aren't handy multistory car parks in Rome. Take a look at live feeds from Rome traffic cams and then see if you want to drive. If you are considering taxis, get the metered rate, and get them after 7am. It can be 25 euros to the nearest metro station, which is Batistini, 8.5Km away. Don't make our mistake of ordering a taxi for 7. They'll show up at five to, then set the meter running and charge you the higher rate for the whole journey. A taxi a day is insanely expensive. To the town center proper it's 40 each way. We went for public transport. A weekly ticket for all buses and metro trains was 16 euros. The 904 bus runs to the second nearest underground (metro) station, Cornelia. The advantage is that you can then hop on buses place to place in the town center between the sights. The bus stops are very intuitively laid out. The bus numbers have a list underneath of every street they drive down, in order, so you can easily follow the path on a map. The 904 goes from Via Selva Candida to Boccea, where the metro station is. The more out of the way bus stops like the one by the hotel don't have times, so there's a lot of waiting. At peak times, the bus is crammed. Get the 904 along Boccea several stops. If you go in the morning, you'll find everyone gets off at the metro. If you miss the stop, it's not a long way to the next, so it's not a big problem to walk back. You are supposed to validate your ticket (though no-one else seems to) by popping it into the machines, which read it, then return it. At Cordelia, get the Anagnina train on line A to the town center, or wherever you want to go. Change at termini for line B. If you do find there's a strike, a taxi may be your only option. You can flag them down on the street. Alternatively, places do day rentals of scooters.

Reviews.Title: “Just as wonderful 3 years later”
Reviews.Author: lpansieri
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to this absolutely lovely hotel with wonderful bedrooms and beautiful grounds. This hotel is well maintained inside out. Fresh fruit and delicious cakes were also served along with a typical continental breakfast. What I find most outstanding here is the pleasant staff who really go all out with their service. Couldn't be better! This hotel is located far from the city center and is for the adventurous who don't mind traveling first by bus then by metro to get to the tourist sites. We highly recommend Selva Candida and we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: MallaEk
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, great and helpful staff, excellent breakfast. We have been there twice and we'll certainly come back again. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good and not so Good”
Reviews.Author: kellyphillips
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Selva Candida for four nights. The hotel is very clean and tidy but we found our room rather small and it says sound proof rooms but they are not. Ours was right next to the lobby and we could hear guests arriving, leaving and any phone calls that came through, along with people snoring in the room next door. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the internet access and use of a laptop in reception was also handy. The location was too far out for us though. Although there is a bus stop over the road from the hotel, it takes 30 mins to get to Cornelia and then a metro ride to where ever your visiting, which when only staying for a short time eats into the day. We also found the road outside the hotel rather unsettling. It has no walk way so when walking back from a restaurant at night with no street lights and rather fast cars, buses and motorbikes whizzing past it is not great. The restaurants were nice though and no more expensive than in the centre. I wouldn't recommend for families with no car. If you have transport it is much better. The best thing about this hotel is the little cafe just up the road from the Hotel, although they speak very little english they are lovely. The cakes, food and drinks are cheaper than most places and the food is great! The breakfast at the hotel we found lovely, there is no hot food but there is plenty of other things. Fresh juice, fruit, bread, meats and cheese are plentiful. Our room also had no english speaking tv channels which although is not a major issue I would have liked to see the news at least. All in all a clean hotel with friendly staff and a nice breakfast but location and room sizes are not the best. We would use a hotel closer to the centre next time and one that probably has tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: coloradowoz
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all previous reviews we picked this hotel to stay at. We were not disappointed, the staff is excellent (friendly and caring) rooms are clean, the property was beautiful and well kept. This is a family run hotel and was a farm several decades ago. If you get a chance ask them about their history (they opened up right after 9/11) We would stay here again. And just as a reminder you can catch a bus to the subway but be cautious walking to the bus stop. The good news, Italian drivers are very aware of pedestrians.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: NataliaSM
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Selva Candida for 3 nights visiting Rome in July 2011. The hotel is really nice, the reception hall, the rooms are perfectly clean and well-decorated. Breakfast is OK but there are no hot meals, so 4 out of 5 for breakfast,The staff at reception is really helpful, providing us with maps and ansewering all our questions.There is free spacious parking in the hotel's garden . But I recommend to choose this hotel only for people with the car. The location is at the outskirts of Rome. If you have a car - no problem ! Drive to the nearest Metro station ( about 10-15min depending on the traffic) park you car on a FREE parking site near the entrance to metro, and explore Rome in a cheap way. 4 euros an all- day- ticket/ no problems wiht parking and petrol.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: paul j
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is on the edge of Rome, if your driving be warned the vespas stop for nobody.The staff in the Hotel were Excellent, if you want Pizza reception will order it for you. The grounds of the Hotel are nice and relaxing. The breakfast could be better, but still a nice place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Best bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: Terri289
Reviews.Content: If you want to wake up on the Spanish steps then this is not the hotel for you. But even so the hotel is a very easy bus and metro ride from the city centre. The staff was warm and friendly and very helpful. Especially being greeted with a bright smile every morning by the wonderful lady in the breakfast room. Unfortunately we did not ask her name, what a pity! We will definitely stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Selva Candida twice during our trip to Italy. The rooms were clean and the staff was the best. Very helpful and polite. They were quick to help us out in anyway. The hotel is quite and far from the city center. We quickley figured out the public transportation to and from the hotel. Never had a problem getting around. The breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sue C
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff, who made us feel right at home. The room was comfortable, clean and quiet; the continental breakfast was very good. Traveling into the city, without one's own vehicle, requires approximately 30 minute taxi fare or a significantly less expensive city bus connection to the subway which takes you to the termini station, well known for professional theft, which I can personally attest to! But that's getting off track from this hotel review. The bus stop is very close, but may require a short walk down a highway with no sidewalks; however, we were told that Italians care too much about their automobiles to hit a pedestrian, who might only damage their vehicle! I'm not sure that there were any restaurants in the immediate area, and the hotel does not have one, but there is a small, local grocery store across the street. Free internet service was a bonus as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay will be back”
Reviews.Author: Rachael36Dublin
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just as described. Lovely place. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We stayed in the 2 bed apartment and it was very spacious and clean. It was very peaceful and quite at night. The reception was open all the time which was great if you needed anything or just wanted to chill with a drink. The hotel was about 30 mins outside the centre of Rome, we didnt have a car so we used public transport. The bus stop was right outside the hotel the only downfall was there is no footpaths on the road and we found it a bit awkward with a wheelchair,plus the buses didn't always come on time. Other than that we found it a great place to stay (would definitly recommend)*

Reviews.Title: “Would love to return”
Reviews.Author: EilidhMac
Reviews.Content: Arrived and go into our room 3 hours early. Nice & clean, comfy bed, aircon and private patio. Handy supermarket just diagonally across from the hotel. Housekeeping was super. Good continental breakfast, the lady who looked after us (her name pronounced Mare-eeta) was lovely about making different coffees to try. Francesco at the front desk provided great info for day trips, printed maps for metro station etc, and was very helpfull and friendly, as was Andrew. Having the car was a godsend, free parking at hotel and close to Metro, comute is fine once you figure it out! Short walk to excellent restaurant Sapori Veri just down the road, but no pavements so wear something bright at night. Good pizzeria on Via Boccea 603. Hotel were happy to sell us stamps & Roma pass, but you need to pay cash for these. Laundry service was good but expensive & took 3 days. Gardens were lovely and well maintained. Fantastic hotel & staff, would highly recommend and would love to return there. Idyllic

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ladykyat
Reviews.Content: The grounds of the property were very well kept. The gentleman at the front desk was one of the nicest I have ever met. He noticed that we were exhausted after a very long trip and offered to order us dinner. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. There was a computer in the lobby with free internet service which was great. The breakfast in the morning was basic but tasty and more than enough to keep us going until lunch time. There was a variety of cakes, pastries and fruits along with toast, jams, nutellla, teas and coffee. We would definitely go back again. The only thing is that the hotel is not close to the sites unless you are willing to take an expensive taxi. The cheaper way is by taking a bus (it stops outside of the hotel) and then the train.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuyoungKim
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 5 nights and felt really comfortable. It's not fancy but characteristic with beautiful gardens. The staff were really friendly and they even emailed when I left a bag in the room so I picked it up before leaving Italy. There're plenty of parking spaces but I ended up driving to central Rome as it's not that easy to use public transport although I don't recommend to drive in Rome at all....! There's also supermarket just in front of the hotel and few restaurants within a few hundreds meter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay!"”
Reviews.Author: lcb62
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and daughter for 3 nights. Quiet, clean rooms, great breakfast. Having a car allowed us to drive to the nearest Metro, and then head into Rome. I believe you can catch a bus close by also if you don't have a car. I would recommend this hotel, and would stay again! Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: DBLBassman
Reviews.Content: We spent a day in Rome after a cruise and this was the perfect place. It's a bit off the beaten path so not an ideal location if you want to jump back and forth between the city center and the hotel but we didn't need to do that. The hotel is in a quiet location. The rooms are clean, in fine condition, comfortable, and functional. The price was excellent and the staff was enormously helpful, friendly, and courteous. An important tip: The air-conditioning is actually controlled electronically from the front desk. If you want to achieve a certain temperature, then you need to simply let them know.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Sigi2007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in May 2011. We loved the hotel, its very nice grounds, the cleanliness and very friendly and helpful staff. We opted for the only room with a private veranda and we found everything clean and very inviting. There was also a high speed wireless internet availability in the room. The location is on the outskirts of Rome but there is a bus connection that takes 15 minutes to get to the subway station connecting one to all the major attractions that Rome has to offer. The only thing is walking to the bus stop - 5 minutes but no sidewalk on the busy street. It is ok during day time but when it is dark one has to be careful because of the road traffic. However, we found staying at this hotel outside the hustle and bustle of Rome a great balacnce because of its quiet setting. The breakfast being served was very niceley prepared in a pretty and cheerful setting. The hotel has no restaurant but there are 2 restaurants in walking distance which we liked. Since we were connecting our trip with a cruise beginning/returning out of Civitavecchia we asked the hotel staff to arrange for private car transportation (airport-hotel-Civitavecchia-airport) which worked out perfectly in terms of punktionality and price. We can not praise the staff enough, very helpful in any way and very friendly! We were amazed about how they proudly had a Tripadvisor posting positioned right on their reception desk! (See picture) If we go back to Rome we will highly consider staying at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful find!”
Reviews.Author: NzlanderOnTheMove
Reviews.Content: We couldn't imagine staying at a nicer place in Rome. Greenery everywhere, a great staff, free breakfast and internet all at a bargain price. The hotel is new, with clean rooms and plenty of parking on the spacious grounds. The 904 bus takes you to the metro station and you're anywhere in Rome in minutes. The staff are knowlegeable and pleasant. They have a friendly, helpful attiude and took the time to answer our questions. I thought the rooms were a little small, but we came to see Rome and the hotel was just a place to sleep and not our main concern. Check this place out, but if you're looking for luxury suites, go elsewhere. They say that you get what you pay for; in this case we got more value than we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the transportation time from the city.”
Reviews.Author: FullmoonCouple
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were a bit hesitant to stay outside the city since we were only in town a couple of days, but we made the right choice. The bus stop is just across the street and between the bus and metro, your in the city in about 45 minutes. We traveled both days to the city and spent all day including dinners in town. By the time we were done, we were beat and needed some peace, quiet and a good nights sleep. Hotel Selva Candida was all that and more. We had a full size bathtub and shower (not very common in Europe) and our own private balcony overlooking the garden on one side and the city on the other. The front desk staff were extremely helpful and the complementary breakfast buffet was excellent. If your traveling by bus and metro, trust us, it's worth the travel time. If you plan to rent a car, it's a "no brainer".... stay there for sure! Can't say enough good things, thanks Hotel Selva Candida !

Reviews.Title: “Selva Candida-- great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chuck4u
Reviews.Content: Prior to our trip to Rome, I read the reviews & got the feeling that the owner was writing all the reviews. They were all so positive. Having now been there, I can honestly say this place is a winner! For those visiting central Rome, I would expect it's a bit of a hassle to get in to town to visit the sights-- it's out near the loop road. For us, it worked out great-- we flew in late at night & stayed there only 1 night as we were going up to Umbria for several days. The street outside is rather busy & the hotel can be difficult to find-- even with a GPS. But, the hotel & the grounds are extremely nice. Nice, quiet location (although the loop road can be heard in the distance from the hotel). The lobby & rooms are decorated nicely. Rooms are a good size & very clean. Beds & bathrooms are rather large and the beds are comfortable. They had satellite TV with many stations. Didn't use the Internet-- so I can't say anything about I'net access (in lobby or via WIFI). Breakfast was good & included in the price of the room. Meats, cheeses, breads, pastries, cereal, juices, coffee, etc. available daily. The dining room was quite nice, too. The staff were very nice to us. They were very responsive to our e-mail questions & requests. And, they were professional & nice to us while at the hotel (one woman came out of her office to bring a soccer ball to my young son while we were playing on the lawn-- very nice of her!). All in all, we were very pleased with our stay at Selva Candida. If you are arriving late to the airport & planning to continue on to Umbria or Tuscany-- this hotel is ideal. If you're staying here & going in to Rome... I suspect that it might be a bit of an effort to get in to town & there are probably better options closer in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, nice room, commute a challenge”
Reviews.Author: sap63
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical when I booked this hotel because of some of the comments, but I must say the service lived up to the excellent rating, especially Florio at the front desk. He was very helpful and patient with us and our questions. The room was clean and spacious, nice bathroom. It was not a small room like I had expected (1st time to Europe, had visions of closet sized rooms) and I liked staying on the outskirts of the city. With all of that said, the only problem we had was getting to/from the hotel. We had the Roma pass good for transportation on buses and subway (which I highly recomment). But when you have luggage, the buses are packed (especially on the weekend), so we ended up taking a cab from the last subway stop to the hotel, the best 12 euro's I spent. If you are prepared for the commute ( which I was from other reviews) and you allow the extra time, then it is well worth the stay. Next time I would rent a car ( from the airport the highway is nice and not much traffic) and drive to the hotel, then drive to a parking area where you can catch the subway in... I would never drive in the city itself!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Firststarryousee
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful front desk. They will do anything to help your stay! free wifi on laptop in lobby. bus and train easy to take into city center ( front desk will help), takes about 40 minutes. Breakfast was pretty good, cappucino was great. Free parking, gated hotel with security videos on. As travelers with cars we are confident this was the best option in Roma!

Reviews.Title: “JUST FACTS- u decide”
Reviews.Author: nishmist
Reviews.Content: Good: Decent size rooms, clean, good hospitality, good breakfast, and bus station opposite to the hotel (every 30 minutes to Cornelia).There is a supermarket just opposite as well. It is a very good option if you plan to rent a car and see Rome. You can park your car in Cornelia & then could (or have to) commute by tube. It was safe to commute. Bus runs throughout the day & night but the tube service stops at 9 (from Sunday to Friday, except Line A) Bad: If you do not plan to rent a car, then you will be wasting at least one hour (30 minutes plus to Cornelia & then another 30 minutes to get to central Rome). Although the bus travel is convenient, the traffic is busy during peak hours & the bus is full. There is no footpath when you walk outside the hotel to the bust station & you literally walk along the road (which in itself is an experience, but can be dangerous if you are not careful) Advice: I know Franseco will definitely say that the bad things have got nothing to do with the hotel & I agree but it is important in the larger context! If you plan to rent a car or if your visiting for a day or two, then I will definitely recommend Selva Candida. If you plan to spend more time in Rome, then I suggest you look for more central locations as it saves time & you can stay quite late & see night life as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, no frills”
Reviews.Author: dnjscheer
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel to be closer to Fiumicino for a morning flight. Knowing its location now, it was better than staying in Rome central, BUT, there are far closer hotels to FCO that would've been better. On a weekday morning the trip from the hotel to FCO was 40 minutes. The driver who was very nice took an alternate route to save time from traffic which helped a bit but was longer in the end. Then he claimed that dropping us at Terminal 3 was the right spot, but it wasn't our airline's location and we had to take another bus to Terminal 5. It seemed he wasn't quite as much in the mood to make the morning trip as he'd been much nicer the night before when he picked us up from Termini. It was great that the hotel offered this service. The rooms and baths are nice, no frills. Our tv did not work. Just one channel, did not change with the remote or on the tv. We didn't ask for service on this as we checked in late and went to bed. The morning breakfast is nice, good selection. For dinner, you do have to walk maybe 150 yards down the street. Crossing is a little dicey and there is no sidewalk for about 50 yards. It's not a huge problem. The restaurant was good but expensive for its location. Still, the only other choice is a bit further to walk. All in all, it was nice to have the option for the driver and the morning breakfast, but if your purpose is to get closer to FCO for a flight, you would probably be better off to stay in one of the actual airport hotels themselves.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rubymint
Reviews.Content: I recommend the Hotel Selva Candida. The location, whilst out of the city, is still close enough to enjoy a day or evening out in Rome and represents an oasis of calm and tranquility that's a welcome tonic from the hustle and bustle of the city centre. We had a hire car when we stayed here and it worked out fine once I got the hang of driving in Rome! When the new road opens down to Via di Casal del Marno this will also improve journey times into the city The hotel staff are great and nothing was too much trouble - for example we asked for a couple of additional pillows when we arrived and they were delivered to the room within 5 minutes. The selection at breakfast is great and the Restuarant Selva Candida (just across the road from the hotel) offers a good selection of food and wine at reasonable prices along with a warm welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: bodaj
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very beautiful with big landscape lawns it felt more in the oasis of tranquility so peaceful . It gave a very homely feeling, felt at home all the time. The staff were very friendly and always ready to help. Room was immaculate housekeeping very good always came back to a very clean room. Wifi superb ,thanks to all the staff at the reception, at the breakfast room and to the housekeeping for making our trip memorable . Will stay with them for sure on our next trip to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Selva Candida”
Reviews.Author: j18sd
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for ~10 days at the end of May 2010. The hotel is clean, spacious (comparing to Rome central hotels) and cheap. We chose this hotel because the package price (3 airline tickets+10 day hotel) was cheaper than buying the airline tickets alone. The hotel offers a good breakfast (free). The hotel property is well maintained with a lot of trees and grasses, making you feel like living in the countryside. The staff are helpful and courteous, except at the end that they wanted to charge me for the stay, while in fact that I already pre-paid to Travelocity. They figured it out and apologized. There is a grocery store right across the street where you can buy water and snacks. It's 50 euro to the airport. The bad part about this hotel is that it's far from any restaurants, the city center and the local subway stations (~10 minutes/ 15 euro taxi ride to the subway station, then 30 minutes subway to the Termini). Because there is no restaurant at the hotel (except for breakfast), we tried to walk to the closest restaurant (10 minutes away). It was challenging because the road is VERY narrow and people drive fast. There is a bus across the street from the hotel that runs every 25-30 minutes, but we could not figure out the schedule. We had trouble finding a taxi to come back to the hotel from the local subway station because there is no taxi stand. We ended up having dinner at a restaurant and asked the waitress to call for a taxi. We once wanted to book a tour to Napoli, but the tour bus would not pick us up at the hotel because it is too far. So keep this in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Beth201
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the outskirts of Rome and has wonderful facilities and a fantastic staff. Each morning we had a wonderful breakfast with cappucino. Nice, modern bathrooms and quiet. The only down side is the distance from downtown Rome (about 40 minutes by public transport). As long as you keep that in mind for your planning, you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay--amazing visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: wxyz321
Reviews.Content: Hotel Selva Candida is a great hotel. The staff was unbelievably friendly and our stay was wonderful. If you are looking for a clean, lovely hotel just outside the city of Rome this is the place for you. You definitely need a car when staying here since it is about a 15 minute drive to the center of the city but it is extremely easy to get there. Just ask the front desk and they will give you directions. The complementary breakfast was great--very delicious and a wide variety of choices. Just make sure you ask for your coffee :) Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hospitality”
Reviews.Author: sara_srs
Reviews.Content: My husband and sixteen month old daughter stayed at hotel Selva for five nights. This was maily following recommendations on this website but also the availability of gardens (running toddler) and the quiet surroundings (sleeping toddler). I cannot fault the place other than the no. 904 bus which can be a little unreliable. The rooms were clean, the staff spoke good Englich and the owner (Francesco) was there most days with a wealth of local knowledge. If you are planning to see Rome but are in no rush or are planning to drive up the coast this is a perfect hotel as it close to the ring road. The only word of warning to future guests would be to be aware that there are no side walks and to use a little caution when approaching the road/getting off the bus. I would definately return and enjoy their hospitality again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MimieJo
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I loved this hotel. The room was very nice & it was a very good size with a lovely Terrance. The Staff was great, spoke great English and were super helpful! If we ever make it back to Rome, we will be staying here again. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Country Atmosphere & Great Service In An Exceptional Value”
Reviews.Author: bradd1
Reviews.Content: While Hotel Selva Candida is not in the country, it does have that type of relaxing atmosphere you yearn for, after a long Trans-Atlantic flight or busy sightseeing day in ancient Rome. We stayed just one night here(Sept. 14th) before setting out to Amalfi the next day,as we had been to Rome in the past. The hotel has spacious grounds and a country or 'old world' feel to the interior. It is spotless,well decorated, and has a great continental breakfast in a bright,cheery space. Most importantly, the hotel staff was extremely helpful at all times when we had questions about dining and driving directions (Florian and also the day manager?...sorry forgot his name....were just great). You will have to catch public transportation to 'downtown' or Old Rome from here, but I can tell you that with the exceptional value and quality of this hotel, you will still be way ahead of the game. Very good dining is a walk away (right turn out of hotel and then on left side of street, just past the little store). A worthwhile stay.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Pakos2010
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband in Rome for some days and I chose this Hotel reading the reviews on this site. I am happy I made this choice, we really enjoyed it! I'll come back for sure and I will recommend you to all my friends. Excellent services, excellent personnel. Thank you so much Selva Candida! Paula

Reviews.Title: “A great week's holiday”
Reviews.Author: redcoat66
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first week in October and had a wonderful time. October is a great time to see Rome, hot days and cool nights, and not so crowded as in summer, though still busy enough. Bit of a trek into the city (bus then metro, 25-45 mins) though we had planned for it; rush hour traffic heavier than we had expected and bus gets very full at peak times. But the Selva Candida is a wonderful oasis at the end of a hot, dusty day in the city, like living in a park. Two nice restaurants within five minutes walk, with a special mention for the Sapori Veri. Great hotel breakfast and very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Kathie059
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the ratings and reviews from trip advisor and was thrilled with my choice. This hotel is beautiful, and an excellent value. The rooms are large by European standards, beautifully decorated as is the hotel, and the bathrooms are very large with lovely hardware and a great big bathtub for you after a day of sightseeing. Yes, the reviews are correct that it is out of town but frankly I think that is a large part of their charm. the grounds are stunning and after a long day of sightseeing it was wonderful to climb back up the hill and relax at the hotel. The restaurant down the road was well priced and had delicious food and the deli/grocery store offered all kinds of wine and bread and treats for us when we were too tired to venture out for dinner. The staff here is excellent and you can tell they pride themselves in superb hospitality-thank you to all the staff, for making our stay so enjoyable. Continental breakfast is included in the price which makes this hotel an even better value for your dollar although I am afraid we had the poor person manning the cappucino machine in the morning shaking her head at the North Americans who couldnt seem to get enough coffee. Special thanks to Fransisco! The Morrow clan

Reviews.Title: “An oais from the bussle of Rome ... a bit inconviennt to get to but well worth it once having arrived.”
Reviews.Author: JasonfromHalifax
Reviews.Content: Getting here by bus from metroand bus from "old Rome" can take upwards of 45 minutes during rush hour or reduced offpeak service. Once having arrived, this hotel is a gem. The staff is over-the-top in friendliness and willingness to accomodate. They wil make suggests or reservations. Rooms are clean; complimentary breakfast fine. Price is an an increcible bargain. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: k10wolf
Reviews.Content: We spent our last night in Rome in this hotel because it was close to the airport. It seemed we were in the wrong place as the area was industrial; however, when we got there, the place was wonderful. Nice seating outside on the lawn to enjoy some wine. The staff was very helpful and the room was HUGE with a bathtub. If you travel in Europe, you know most places only have smal showers. The staff recommended a restaurant that was 40 meters (within walking distance) which had fabulous pizza and wine (couldn't read the rest of the menu). Very convenient to the airport, but not convenient to downtow Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect, highly reccomended”
Reviews.Author: athanasiosm
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel from its personal internet site, which had an offer for motorcyclists. The hotel is amazing, very stylish and very clean. The staff were very kind and helpful. Although it is located outside Rome, you can be in the center of town very quickly (approximately 10 min with a motorbike). We enjoyed our stay there (3 nights) and if we go to Rome again, we will certainly stay at Selva Candida !!!

Reviews.Title: “Warm Hotel and very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: bosa1975
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in this hotel and we all enjoyed the atmosphere . The hotel was clean and room service was excellent. The reception welcomed us with a great attitude. They gave information about Rome including maps and how to travel there. The free parking and free wifi was really a plus. Thanks for the excellent time we spent as a family in Rome and for sure Selva Candida was a huge part of it.

Reviews.Title: “Francesco made this a fabulous place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: loveshorses08
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter for our first 3 nights in Italy and we loved it. Francesco checked us in, and numerous times during our stay he went above and beyond to make our stay more wonderful and memorable. One night we were disheartened to find that we got off of the bus about 2 miles too soon, and were not walking a minute when a car stopped to see if we needed a ride, and it was Francesco! The breakfast was one of the best we experienced during our 12 days in Italy. The hotel was easy enough to get to from Rome's city center once we figured out the bus system.

Reviews.Title: “Who is planting these reviews?”
Reviews.Author: Wasepia
Reviews.Content: Do any research, and you will find that this hotel is not in Rome, but a suburb, at least thirty minutes from the city center. It is located on a two-lane road, with no shoulder. When you step out of the hotel entrance, you are on a road with no shoulders. Cars are whizzing barely inches from you. You are literally risking your life to get to the bus stop. I mean, LITERALLY.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff, very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: JRRStaffordshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Selva Candida from 25th to 28th June, 2010 - a surprise break for our wedding anniversary booked by our eldest daughter. It's a real little treasure - out in the countryside - off the beaten track to a certain extent - but lovely gardens to sit and enjoy. Our room was really nice and overlooked the garden. The bathroom was modern and spotlessly clean. We had the feeling that the rooms had recently been refurbished. It's a really pretty location, although it may not suit some people as it is out of the city. However, we were advised to obtain a Roma Pass (which was available from reception) and this gives you free transport for 3 days and free entry to 3 museums including the colisseum, but not the vatican. Breakfast was fine - cold meat, cheese, cereal, choice of croissants and cakes - fresh fruit - coffee, tea, fruit juice. This was plenty of choice for us. The hotel is too far out to return to comfortably during the day and then go back to Rome in the evening - but - there is a very nice restaurant within walking distance - this is also called Selva Candida,although it has nothing to do with the hotel. We went into Rome for the full day, then came back to the hotel in the evening, showered and changed and then went to the restaurant which we were happy with. There is also a small supermarket opposite the hotel where you can get most thing, including water. The thing that made our stay special was the friendliness of the staff. Nothing was too much trouble. A big thank you to Florian who advised us on all sorts of things, travel routes, finding our way round, etc. All other staff were also very helpful (sorry I don't know everyone's name). All in all, we had a lovely time and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely suggest HOTEL SELVA CANDİDA”
Reviews.Author: ouzun
Reviews.Content: Çok güzel ve rahat bir otel otobüs + metro ile her yere ulaşım kolay durak giriş kapısından çıkınca 200 mt bilet satan dükkan 300 mt uzaklıkta .Personel çok yardım sever. We stayed Hotel Selva Candida for 3+1 nights during the end of june and 3rd of July with my wife ,my dautgher and my sons. We booked a quadruple room (402) . Bathroom and room were very clean. Breakfast was ok. Very friendly staff on the reception area who always greeted us with a smile Good access to the city (Vatican and Roma) get on the bus line 904 and get off Cornelinia metro station and than 15 minutes to reach where ever you want in Rome .Bus stop is 200 mt. right on the gate . Night bus n2 goes and comes from Piazza Venezia Only 1 euro per person day ticket 3 euro you can in tabacco shop ıt is 300 mt on right side of the hotel gate). I will definitely suggest this place to everybody

Reviews.Title: “Pleasure , everything we hoped for....”
Reviews.Author: Papazel
Reviews.Content: Our stay In Selva Candida Hotel from June 9 -June 14 .2010 was rewarded. Staff ,especially Francesco was excellent. Hotel very clean, quiet . Enjoyed quiet evening sitting outside . Commuting to city by bus and Metro was easy. Approximately 1 hour in the morning and one hour at night. No problem. Driving car in rush hour is impossible . Liked fast Internet connection, which was very important to us. Would recommend this Hotel to anybody going to Roma .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LauraSa-99
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean modern hotel VERY tastefully decorated. It is situated outside the city center but definitely worth the journey. Very friendly staff on the reception area who always greeted us with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “cozy bed and breakfast style hotel”
Reviews.Author: evnjumpr
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Silva Candida was an excellent choice for what my wife and I were looking for. We wanted a smaller quaint hotel that was quiet but still offered great service, breakfast and away from the hectic pace of Rome but still with good access to the city. The staff was extreamly friendly and very helpful. Francesco in particular was a great for advice in traveling around the country when I had to drive to Venice and going to a beach near Rome. The hotel is on the north western outskirt of Rome and my only advice for getting there is to pay the 50 euro fee for the hotel to bring you from the airport if you have a lot of baggage. The public transportation directions to the hotel are great and taking the train from the airport to the main Termini station in Rome to get the subway from there is not bad at all. Especially for someone use to using the New York subway system. The most interesting part was getting the bus from the Cornila station to the hotel. It took me about 15 min of walking around the enterance of the subway station to find the right bus stop. It is just north of the subway exit in a cluster of many bus stops about a block away. It may have just been the time of day but the bus was quickly packed as I kept bumping people with my luggage. Not knowing where the hotel was, I was a little concerned about where we were going as we got farther out of the city. I couldnt see any street signs but I was able to commicate with someone about where the hotel was. They pointed it out as we drove by and the bus stopped just short of the hotel. If you are an adventerous soul go for it. Total travel time on the public system was almost 2 hrs. Drive time from the airport is about 15 min. After getting to the hotel I had rented a car and we would then drive to the Cornila train station to get into the city. There is free public parking near the previously mentioned bus station. The staff also recommended a great resturant just down the street called the San Gemma (I believe). We told them the hotel had recommend them and asked for the house menu for the night. I was an amazing meal at 25 euro a person. There is also a little market across the street where you can get the usual items one might need to include great cheese, meats and wine. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, relaxing area”
Reviews.Author: TravelingPilots
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful in their recommendations and when we were having travel difficulties. The hotel itself was quite and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience to live again.”
Reviews.Author: Wangwayxing
Reviews.Content: It was not the firs time for me to go to Rome, I am usually there for buissnes so I know how caotic and stressfull is the city. This time instead I decided to take my wife with me and visit the country as tourists. When it came the time to book the hotel in Rome I didn't want her to be in a noisy hotel facing the daily and evening racket so I opted for i more quiet place to stay. Searching with trip advisor iI came across the Hotel Selva Candida and seemed to match all my needs: a quiet and relaxing place to stay and jet not far from Rome. So hopping to find it in the Hotel Selva Candida we booked a room. What we found at the arrival was by a long shot better then what we expected. It is well connected with the city center by a bus that stops right in front of the hotel and the warm welcome and service I ve found there was better than in all the other hotels I have been.The room we had was quiet and confortable and thanks to the wireless connection we could comunicate with our friends and family. I will personaly go back to the hotel Selva Candida in my future visits or Rome and with the greate value for money I would raccomand anybody to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place!”
Reviews.Author: funmakers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely and an oasis from the suburban location, set amongst palm trees and serene landscaping. It was a great place to get to the airport easily. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the breakfast was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A trip to Rome... stay in Selva Candida - friendly, comfortable, beautiful grounds and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: elsacarinafisher
Reviews.Content: Selva Candida is great. It is a really nice place to stay in a nice residential area with beautiful grounds and free parking. The staff always go out of their way to help us and we feel at home there. I will not stay anywhere else when I go to Rome. There is public transport that can take you into the center of Rome from there - so getting around is not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “A jail disguised as a hotel: truly awful”
Reviews.Author: pageonedaily
Reviews.Content: Truly appalling in every way, this is a jail disguised as a hotel. The rooms are about the size of a jail cell without even a chair to sit on, much less a table, and look out to a dark, dank courtyard with no view whatsoever. Those that do have a view outside enjoy a view of Rome's busiest freeway a few hundred yards away. The breakfast was minimal. The staff - and specially the management - were surly, arrogant, abusive and very unpleasant. We left after one night. You've been warned. An expensive rip-off. Stay here at your peril.

Reviews.Title: “Francesco for president!!”
Reviews.Author: HUcouple
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from Rome, stayed there only 3 nights. Well, for us Rome is a little bit dirty and loud and not well-organized. BUT we liked this hotel very much - it is a Treasure Island in this town! We booked the transfer, so a taxi waited us at Fiumicino, which was useful regarding we arrived in the evening. As the restaurants were closed, we've been without dinner, but a "young man" at the hotel said he'll prepare something for us: so we got cheese, salami, etc-etc and red wine :) Next morning we were told by other guests that this young man was Francesco the hotel manager. Last day he personally took us to the airport! He informed us about all the restaurants we should try, and we were really satisfied with those: cul de sac (traditional restaurant, but there is usually a queue!!), saporo veri (fish restaurant not far from the hotel), monte carlo (pizza, pasta). FYI a first course is around 7-10 EURs at these restaurants (of course there are more expensive dishes), so it is possible to have a dinner for two in 30-40 EUR. Italian wines are surprisingly good. At home we tasted just expensive, but no so delicious wines, so it was a nice suprise. I think the hotel looks romantic, a mediterranean style building - not a boring block. Yes, as the other travellers said, it is a little far from the center, yes, there is no sidewalk, but it was nice to be outside of the town after so much noise in the city. We always find important to have a clean, nice bathroom in the hotel room, and at this value, you'll never find a same level bathroom in Roma - we checked around 20-30 hotels' pictures at Tripadvisor. One tip: we found useful the Roma Pass (for travelling and entering attractions), if you stay for 3 days as we did, it is worth to buy these I think. So thank you very much Francesco, we will tell all our friends that Hotel Selva Candida is a brilliant choice in Rome - and if we'll return to Rome, we'll stay at you for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: CM_London1
Reviews.Content: I looked long and hard for a hotel that provided parking as Rome was the start of a 10 day road trip around Italy, that was not only affordable but also had easy access into the city . After seeing all the other reviews on Tripadvisor I decided to book this hotel and am so glad that I did. From when we arrived we were treated extremely well by the staff, and they were only to happy to answer our questions and book tickets online for us for the vatican tour and the colleseum guided tour. This saved us a lot of time. The room was clean and the bathroom was a good size too! There is a bus stop right outside the hotel which takes you to the closest Metro station, which we used on Day 1 (the hotel sells tickets for this), Day 2 and 3 we drove and parked at the Vatican City and Collesseum (despite being recommended not to drive, with sattelite navigation this was not a problem at all and there are parking garages by both sites). All in all we had a great stay and I would recommend this to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal parity the price-quality for travelers on the car”
Reviews.Author: Kirilll
Reviews.Content: Very cosy pure hotel in the Italian rural style. The well-groomed perfectly well issued territory. The benevolent personnel, always ready to render the necessary help and to answer all interesting questions. Cosy, spacious enough rooms. Are cleaned every day. It is a little noisy in rooms which windows leave on Circonvallazione Settentrionale if the window is opened. But I would not name, it is a problem as in rooms there is a conditioner and to open windows there is no necessity. A free parking in hotel territory. Wi-Fi without problems. Through road there is a grocery shop and restaurant. Considering hotel location, and in view of a parity the price-quality, it is an ideal variant for travellers on the car. Not so convenient location for those who travels without the car. Also it would be advisable to diversify a breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was so friendly and attentive that there couldn't be anything wrong - they solved every possible problem.”
Reviews.Author: jessikal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Selva Candida based on other TripAdvisor ratings in May 2010. The other reviews do not lie, this hotel offers some of the best service I have experienced before. Nothing was a problem for them! Our flight over was delayed and we didn't arrive until about 11pm. By the time we got settled and got the kids to bed it was almost midnight, and we hadn't had dinner! I asked the desk and was told nothing was open at that time, and the hotel doesn't have a restaurant. At most hotels I would have gone back to the room disappointed - instead, the desk clerk took me into the breakfast kitchen, sliced up fresh cheese and prosciutto for me, and made us a plate with toasts and fruit to take back to the room! (and without charge!) Although we were aware that it was a bit outside the city center, we decided to take the risk due to having small kids with us (ages 3.5 and 1 year). Experience has told us that being right in the center can be noisy and, for what we wanted (an apartment, or a separate sleeping room for the kids) also very expensive. Plus we were coming from the countryside and had a car, so wanted to be able to park. Selva Candida offered us free parking, decent grounds surrounding the property for the kids to play, and a good price. Plus, the convenience to the highway/ring road counterbalanced the bus and metro trip to get to the city center. (We drove to city center one day and it was a relatively easy 20 min drive - otherwise the bus stops right across the street) We stayed in room 401, their largest apartment, which has a separate bedroom and then a sleeper sofa in the main room where my husband and I slept. The baby crib/bed they provided was lovely with nice linens, unlike the pack n play type beds we have had at other hotels. It was relatively quiet and the beds were very nice. There is free wireless internet at the hotel. Unfortunately it did not reach to our apartment but was easy enough to sit in the lounge chairs or at tables in the lobby. My dad stayed in the main building and had internet in his room. At one point his computer was acting up and he brought it to the desk to see if it was because of the internet. It wasn't, but that didn't stop the desk clerk from taking 10 minutes to sit and fiddle with my dad's laptop until he fixed the issue for him. One disappointment we had initially is that there is no kitchenette in the room and no restaurant at the hotel (there is a bar though), so it was a challenge to heat bottles for the baby and take care of his dinner (he cannot wait to eat or even stay awake until 8pm or so when restaurants open in Italy). When I asked the owner of the hotel if they had a microwave or something that we could use, he brought in his own - from home!!! - for us to keep in our room the whole stay. It made such a difference, especially at 6am, and took away all the stress of having to worry about feeding the kids when everything is closed. In short, anything that could have been an issue at this hotel was solved instantly by their attentive staff, who was always willing to think outside the box to come up with a solution. We will definitely stay there again on future trips to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: GBarbeau
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Italian country style villa hotel with gardens. Excellent service and very good price. Lovely, clean and very comfortable room. Enjoyed a wholesome Italian breakfast. Located 30 min. by bus and metro to center of Rome and well worth coming back to this quiet and beautiful hotel after a day in the busy city of Rome. I highly recommend Selva Candida for its quality, price and attentive personnel. Worth more than a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel value near Rome!”
Reviews.Author: moodymolly
Reviews.Content: We just spent three nights in this amazing hotel outside of Rome. It is clean, the parking is free and the Internet is reliable and free with the room price also. The first two nights were only $75 Euro but the last night was $89 Euro due to the lack of vacancys. It is farther out of town but the staff was helpful and even sold bus tickets at the front desk. It was a 20-30 minute ride on the bus and then we spent $11 Euro each for a three day metro and bus ticket. There is a nice grocery store right across the street and we picniced on the tables provided on the patio. This hotel had the most comfortable bath tubs and was nice and quiet. A great place and people.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Andrew1616
Reviews.Content: I would like to say that our stay at the Selva Candida Hotel was “ Fantastic !“ The staff was really friendly and the Hotel Manager was an extreme help in everything - especially on tips on where to park our rented car in Rome for free, shopping malls,best sights to see, were to have great Italian dinners etc etc. We had two rooms which were clean, airy and the beds were comfortable. For breakfast, one can find a large selection of cereals, yogurts, juices, coffee, teas, Italian bread, pastries, cold cuts and cheeses. Hotel is close to supermarket across the road. We had a car and drove to the Metro station to go into Rome centre which was quite close. On the whole, a nice experience!

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: european_kiwis
Reviews.Content: Selva Candida's Location is redeemed by it's charm. The hotel is on a main bus route and it was very easy to get in and out of Rome. Our hosts were very knowledgeable and helpful, giving us information on places to visit in Rome, and various transport systems around the city. They made us feel very comfortable and we didn't feel like guests, but like old friends. They always took the time to talk to us about our day. Our room was very comfortable and for the affordable price we paid, we were surprised by the clean facilities and services. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is after a quiet hotel with it's own charm.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Hospitality !!!”
Reviews.Author: ElenaRiga
Reviews.Content: The BEST SERVICE I had in Italy so far ! I spent there 4 days and felt like beeing at home from the 1st minute... Cosy, very clean, quite, good breakfast, very much customer oriented staff. Perfect for those, who travel with a car, but public transportation is also ok - (only 30 min by bus nr. 904 + 10 min on metro from Cornelia station and you are in the centre on the morning or away of the busy city in the evening). One more and very important thing - it was a 1st time also when I had a COMFORTABLE bed in Italy - not so firm as in other italian hotels where I've stayed before. The owners are just great, especially Francesco ! And I appreciate very much a unique night Rome tour he made for me on a bike :)! Wish all the best for the staff and will definatelly reccomend them to my friends !

Reviews.Title: “Nice cozy family hotel in a quiet area outside of Rome's center”
Reviews.Author: ZikLila
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to Rome during a 4-city Spring Break trip in Europe (Paris-Venice-Rome-Barcelona, in that order.) It was our first time in Europe so we did not know exactly how public transportation was like in every city, yet I trusted the reviews and chose this hotel. I love the whole experience overall. Here are some thoughts/tips after our stay: # Location: Hotel Selva Candida is not located right in the center of Rome. Besides that fact, it's a wonderful place to stay. Keep reading for tips on how to get to the hotel. # Transportation: When we arrived at the Roma Termini, we took the train (Linea A, Battistini side) to Cornelia. From Cornelia the bus 904 took us to very close to the hotel. We got to Rome in a very rainy evening, which means it was both wet and dark outside - so the commute took us more than an hour. The next day was much better - it took us half an hour to get from the hotel to Cornelia. If you get to Rome on a day with bad weather, I'd suggest you contact the hotel to see whether they could pick you up (at a cost of course) or ask them how much it should cost you to take a cab to the hotel. Note that there are many buses that go to Cornelia. You should ask the hotel for a list of these buses - there should be no difficulty to get back from the center of Rome to Cornelia. For instance, the next night we took Bus 916 from Piazza Venezia to Cornelia then Bus 904 back to the hotel. Also note that Via Selva Candida is a rather narrow street with no sidewalks on both sides. Once you get off the bus, try to walk as close to the side as possible. It's about a 2 or 3-minute walk from the bus stop to the hotel gate. One last tip on transportation: ask the hotel for suggestions on when/how you should go about taking public transportation vs. a cab vs. the hotel car to the airport or the train station. Francesco actually drove us to the Fiumicino airport (FCO) at a reasonable price. There is ample parking space at the hotel... if you're brave enough to drive around Rome. Traffic is quite crazy. #Amenities/Atmosphere: I know there are other things that are supposed to be more important, but the first thing I notice in a hotel room is the bathroom. The bathroom was well-organized, clean, and elegant. Same for the entire room. It might take you a little while to get used to the quietness if you're used to living in an apartment like mine which is always a little noisy no matter when. The hotel decor is very attractive with an overall warm yellow tone. You'll feel more at home here than in most other large-chain hotels. Breakfast is from 7:00 - 10:00 AM. We missed our first breakfast, yet Francesco, the hotel manager, made us some cappuccino and brought us some croissant and bakery items after the breakfast buffet was over. You don't see that often at other hotels. # Wifi: this is a biggie for me wherever I go. The hotel provides free wifi throughout - just ask for the username and password. For some reason the settings didn't work with my Firefox or Chrome or Safari, so I had to use Internet Explorer. If you use IE, do this before connecting to their wireless: Open up IE. Go to Tools | Internet Options | Connections | LAN Settings, then check "Automatically detect settings". If for some reason wifi doesn't work well in your room, just go to the lobby and it should run like a free horse. # Summary - what I liked best: the very helpful staff at the hotel (especially Francesco), the nice decor and organization of the room, the overall atmosphere in the hotel. Transportation could be a huge con to you, but like I said, once you get a hang of it it's not that bad. # Summary - what I liked least: the unusually bad weather in Rome for us which made the commute to the hotel more difficult than it should have been. Also, I wish the hotel were closer to the center of Rome. At the same time, there would've been no quietness if it were. And the price would've been much higher.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, but a little far from the city”
Reviews.Author: Andi_and_Thao
Reviews.Content: As we're quite the adventurous couple, we always get to the hotels by ourselves, i.e. without taxis, escorts etc. But to reach this hotel was a nightmare, even for us. This was our first time in Rome, so we just printed out a route we planned with the public transport system online. Only thing is there was a mistake in the calculation so in theory we started off some 20km east of the airport. The busdrivers and ticket sellers are quite unhelpful and so we ended up with 4 hours from the airport to the hotel, but we made it and just with public transport. While the staff in the hotel is really great and friendly, you can't say that about the majority of the Romans. We got ripped off at a tourist "bar", as we bought 2 "panini" for the shown price of 1,40€ and 2,80€ and in the bill he stated 4€ each "because we sat down on the table". Quite pathetic really, but other than that Rome was alright. The hotel is nice and quiet, the staff really helpful and friendly; everything else has been already said, I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Best valued Hotel in all of Rome, hands down - an awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: Jnosko
Reviews.Content: I was in and out of Rome several times over a one month period. During this time, I stayed in about 5 different hotels. When I hit the Hotel Selva Candida, it was very reasonably priced, unparalleled service, nice rooms, nice breakfast in the morning, and overall just a very nice place to stay in. It was better than many much higher priced hotels. If I were going back to Rome, would stay here and only here!

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating and easy to work with staff.”
Reviews.Author: TheRoomReporter
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel Selva Candida, and found it a great experience. I went with a large group, and the hotel was very accommodating for everyone. The rooms were nice, the general atmosphere was clean and nice, and the staff there were willing to help with anything we needed. All in all, I would fully recommend this hotel to anyone going to Rome. It is situated about 20mins from Vatican City by car, and it on a beautiful estate in the countryside of Rome. It is about 15-20mins from the airport by car, and all around it is convenient. I got great remarks from all of my colleagues, and I will definitely stay there again if/when I return to Rome. Thanks to the staff and management of the hotel, and I look forward to staying with you again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and lovely”
Reviews.Author: lpansieri
Reviews.Content: It's located in the suburb of Casalotti at the city limitsof Rome. I would not recommend it for those who do not want to spend time travelling back and forth to the tourist areas of Rome using public transportation. Its better for those with a car. It's quiet, safe, very clean and comfortable. The grounds are gated and beautiful. The young members of the staff are exceptionally pleasant. There is a small supermarket just across the street and a good restaurant just a bit further down.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service any time of the day or night.”
Reviews.Author: Tanus_9
Reviews.Content: I experienced very good service at any time during the day or late at night. The rooms were always clean and nicely set-up. I also enjoyed the morning breakfasts, very Italian.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect environment for working and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: emaruffi
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in the hotel and I could appreciate the staff friendliness and service. The environment is perfect, a mix of tradition with modern services.

Reviews.Title: “Classic place, with friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: deisdu
Reviews.Content: Service was great and rooms were spacious. Concierge was very friendly and knew not only what tourists wanted to see, but also what he liked in the city, as well as local resources. Location is just outside the busy city (a plus), and still close to the Vatican and other sights. Nice place.

Reviews.Title: “The best service I have ever had in Italy”
Reviews.Author: T4Preps
Reviews.Content: The staff were genuinely friendly and helpful. They went out of their way to service us and accomodate us, even going so far as to ensure we could find another good hotel when they were fully booked. The environment was comfortable and the staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: shokker5
Reviews.Content: Hotel Selva Candida's staff could not be more helpful. They were the best!!!! I own a small construction company in the United States ad we just don't get customer service like this in the U.S. The hotel manger Francesco helped us on every request and even picked up at Airport himself to ensure we were taken care of. When in Rome I will stay at Hotel Selva Candida everytime. Our rooms were very clean and our service was awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISAPPOINTING - NOT RECOMMENDED!”
Reviews.Author: Lynn94
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night out of the three that we were booked! If you are going to Rome to tour the sites. DO NOT STAY HERE! It is very far from the city centre - not at all as described in books or other sites. From the Termini it is the second to last stop on the line and then another 30 minute bus ride. Add on the wait times and it is well over an hour. Once we finally got there after a brutal commute - it was 19:30 and we found there was no restaurant at the hotel and no where in the area open to dine. The room was okay, breakfast mediocre, and we thought we would stick it out until waited for the bus for 40 minutes to get into Rome center. We decided to pack our bags and find another hotel. We only had two full days in Rome and weren't going to waste 4 or more hours a day on or waiting for public transit. Traffic is terrible in this area and you stand on a road with a speed limit posted at 80 km and no footpath - basically pushing yourself into the hedges to avoid being hit by cars. The hotel staff was not sympathic at all to our concerns and charged us for the two additional nights that we did not stay there. I think it is lousy that we had to paid for a room we didn't use. Regardless - we found a lovely hotel 2 Metro stops from the Termini and were very happy that we decided to pack up and leave.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place, far from Center”
Reviews.Author: themyoungs
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast with traditional light Italian type foods and wonderful espresso. Spacious free parking, but near the "Ring" so a bit far from convenient travel to and from the center. Helpful staff and clean rooms. Very pleasant! Free wireless but only available in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great retreat for the price!”
Reviews.Author: daisyle
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was like a resort! It was clean and beautiful and spaceous! My only complaint is that is was a little far from the main attractions in Rome. The bus stop was right outside the hotel. It was about a 30 minute bus ride to the closest metro station. Other than that, the everything about the hotel was excellent. The hotel offered one of the best breakfast spread I've ever had, spacious room and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mrshlomi
Reviews.Content: The staff were amazing. The hotel is easy to get to, and in a nice out of the way spot in a tranquil suburb which is close enough to quickly get anywhere in Rome, but out of the way enough to have peace and relaxation. The staff were amazing and attentive, the value was great and the breakfast was superb. We will be coming back, and recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Best team of Selva Candida”
Reviews.Author: Greeks
Reviews.Content: we had great time in that perfect hotel and that was first of all from the place that hotel is and secondly from the people who work there. from the recepionists to the cleaners or to everyone else. they are all there with a big smile on their faces and they are always ready to help you and serve you in any case... we are not consider them as workers but only as friends.. that is the way that they treated us. so we surelly think that we will be back there sometime in the future

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gckhd55
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay while visiting Rome! It is wonderful for the Car Traveler as it has plenty of parking in a very secure gated area right in front of hotel. Many many hotels around Rome just do not have parking!! It is only a couple miles to the subway and the hotel helped direct me to a good place to leave the car and it was free parking! Driving arounf Rome is crazy and parking is few and far between! But for a hotel that has a fair loactions - Plenty of Parking - a super nice staff / I would recommend for sure! If or when I return to visit Rome, I am sure I would retrun for another stay! The rooms are really very nice - Do have internet - TV with CNN - Room we had, also had a private Balcony Patio!

Reviews.Title: “The best value hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: lgutierrez98
Reviews.Content: We were 3 families traveling together (8 people). We traveled from the United States to Germany, France and Italy for 17 days. We stayed in 5 different hotels. Hotel Selva Candida was the best hotel of our trip. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the towels were soft, the complimentary breakfast was delicious. The service was excellent and Francesco was the best!! We will definitely recommend Hotel Selva Candida to anyone who mentions traveling to Rome. Thank you for an enjoyable stay. Note: It was easily accessible via the 904 bus which is best caught at the Cornelia metro stop. Exit the bus immediately after passing it on your right.

Reviews.Title: “Momments of pleasure in Hotel Selva Candida Rome.”
Reviews.Author: efiGreece1980
Reviews.Content: Hotel Selva Candida is in excellent position of Rome. The position of the hotel is not close to the Historical monuments (20 klm) but in a really quiet area. You can reach the hotel by car or by bus, and the parking place is really convenient. The hotel is surounded by a really nice garden. At my stay in Hotel Selva Candida Rome the weather conditions were excellent and i really enjoyed my morning coffe at the beautiful garden. The service was excellent and the rooms were really confortable. I strongly recommend this facilities to everyone that wants to visit Rome for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: stagnitto
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel about 10 miles west of Rome. The rooms were very clean and the setting was quiet. It is a converted farm house and looks elegant. A beautiful yard and garden area with big palm trees. You do need a car but we took the bus which stops across the street to Cornelia station and took the trains into the city center. It was a pleasant experience. Breakfasts were very good. The ham and cheese were very good as was the pastries and cereal and other goodies. The bar makes you coffee the way you want it.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Selva Candida
HotelInfo.Address: Via di Selva Candida, 200, 00166 Rome, Italy
